info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 12:36PM EDT until April 7 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County.
Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...
Portage River near Vicksburg affecting Kalamazoo County.
.Two to three inches of rain fell Wednesday, which is causing minor flooding on some area rivers. Another round of rain is expected Friday night and this will keep river levels elevated until they fall for good towards the beginning of next week.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Portage River near Vicksburg.
* WHEN...Until Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Expect overflows into wooded areas, yards, a few outbuildings, and farmland adjacent to the river. At 5.5 feet, Minor basement flooding begins at the first house near the gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 5.3 feet this afternoon. It will remain near flood stage through early next week. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.4 feet on 03/31/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING
